originalText.text: I just recently had the privilege of having Dr Lager perform arthroscopic surgery on my knee. I am a person of great details and expect nothing but the best. The moment I walk into his office I received professionalism starting with the front desk.  Dr. Lager was a gem I didn’t know existed. He was very knowledgeable regarding my issues and explained everything in great detail. My surgery was performed in a prestigious place and the surgery went well. My healing period was just amazing. I recommend Dr Lager 100%

originalText.text: Dr. Lager is professional and thorough. His staff is friendly and accommodating, and the practice as a whole is good at being ready for scheduled appointments.

text.text: Dr. Lager is professional and thorough. His staff is friendly and accommodating, and the practice as a whole is good at being ready for scheduled appointments.

originalText.text: Dr. Lager is friendly, smart and quite knowledgeable. Gave me hope regarding  my condition I highly recommend him!

text.text: Dr. Lager is friendly, smart and quite knowledgeable. Gave me hope regarding  my condition I highly recommend him!

originalText.text: I saw Dr. Alpert at Gotham City Orthopedics for a hand injury and she has been extremely attentive and helpful.  Great follow-up and super accommodating to my busy schedule.

text.text: I saw Dr. Alpert at Gotham City Orthopedics for a hand injury and she has been extremely attentive and helpful.  Great follow-up and super accommodating to my busy schedule.

originalText.text: I've been through many IME's , I seen him a year ago, I believe he gave an honest report, your wait time  will vary,but it's about average, I feel this time they listen more than the last time, I'm making this review before I get my report, maybe I'm being optimistic but I believe this guy, is honest and fair, I'll leave an update, I am back with my update,I guess he's a paid doc for the other side if it's a comp case, but in all fairness,we each have a doc to give our side, I just do understand how or why they ask you to bring copies of your MRI, then chooses not to look at them,he will have his own assessment and opinion,but you can't fake an MRI, that is the part I don't like, that's where dishonesty comes to play, I would suggest you take out all of your medical records and try to get him to review them with you,if he does, then submits something different,I would bring that up with your lawyer and possibly the judge,most lawyers have a relationship with the opposing party,
